page.title: 16PLACES OF INTEREST(cont.d)
page.content: dancing bear made from oak . There are a lot of oil paintings . Once one was stolen . It is a picture of a woman holding a baby. It was stolen without its frame , rolled up and put into a ruck sack and was taken abroad . There are a number of interesting houses in the area . Mrs . Bennett's house is called Oak End Cottages. It was built in 1600.It used to be two cottages , but it is now one.It is made of wattle and daub , and has oak and elm beams. Mr. Merrett's house is called Velthouse Farm . It was built in 1630 and made of laum and plaster . Mrs. Smith's house is called Hembury House . It was built at the turn of the century . It is made of red brick, but in some places it is made of wattle and daub . It has a tiled roof and no beams . These are only three of the houses in
